Body:
I have been trying to run Hello World program on Iris mote in Cooja simulator. The hello-world.c is in /examples/hello-world/, the makefile is as given below.

CONTIKI_PROJECT = hello-world	all: $(CONTIKI_PROJECT)		#UIP_CONF_IPV6=1		CONTIKI = ../..	include $(CONTIKI)/Makefile.include

On typing 

make program1.upload TARGET=iris MOTES=/dev/ttyUSB0

I get

make: *** No rule to make target `program1.upload'. 	stop

The program runs on Skymote successfully.

I am using Contiki 2.7 currently.

Can anyone please guide me on how to run programs on Iris mote? In Motes--> Add Motes, the option for iris is not available. Please kindly arrange to provide the solution.
@Gaelan, I have provided the makefile content in the edited version. Is it possible that the make command of mine is wrong? please do help.

@kfx, I have a real iris mote with me. Even if iris mote is not available, the cooja simulator has no option for deploying iris motes using Motes-->Add motes option. Can you please tell me how to enable the option? Also, please kindly elaborate on the binary file name specification in .csc file.
Unless you have a real Iris mote, uploading the firmware is not necessary. Simply specify the binary file name in the simulation configuration (the `.csc` file).
Well if it's hello-world then you should run `make hello-world.upload` instead of `make program1.upload`.
The simulation might not work: the IRIS platform was probably never supported in Cooja. After 2.7 Contiki IRIS mote support was dropped completely.
We will probably not be able yo help you without seeing you current Makefile. Could you edit this question to add its current contents?
